what.content: The Neonatal Encephalopathy Cooling Guidelines (NECG) Tool identifies patients at risk for neonatal encephalopathy and incorporates the numerous criteria that must be met in order for a patient to meet current guidelines for therapeutic hypothermia treatment.

pearls.p1: Neonatal encephalopathy is defined as a condition in neonates when two of the following signs are present: altered consciousness, altered muscle tone, or abnormal primitive reflexes.
pearls.p2: Therapeutic hypothermia is an active treatment that aims to achieve and maintain a specific body temperature for a duration of time in an effort to improve health outcomes in infants with perinatal brain injury. In order for therapeutic hypothermia to be recommended, the patient must meet clinical and biochemical criteria.
pearls.p3: Sarnat staging is used to categorize encephalopathic infants as normal, mild, moderate, or severe. To meet the current criteria for therapeutic hypothermia, infants must be moderately or severely encephalopathic.
pearls.p4: Neonates who are encephalopathic are eligible for therapeutic hypothermia, however, encephalopathy can have many causes. Therefore, clinical judgement should be used to determine if a patient should receive therapeutic hypothermia treatment on a case by case basis.

why.content: Therapeutic hypothermia is one of the only treatments available to decrease neurological morbidity in patients with perinatal brain injury. The Neonatal Neurocritical Care Group at the Children's Hospital of Wisconsin has identified that physicians often incompletely document clinical and biochemical criteria needed to support decisions to initiate therapeutic hypothermia. The purpose of this tool is to assist healthcare providers with decision making and documentation in cases where therapeutic hypothermia treatment is a consideration.

form1.title: Qualifying Questions
form1.question: Is the neonate's condition suggestive of encephalopathy?

form2.title: Neurological Questions: Seizures
form2.question: Does the neonate present with seizures?

form4.title: Qualifying Questions
form4.q1: Is the infant's gestational age 36 weeks or more?
form4.q2: Is the infant 6 hours old or less?
form4.q3: Is the infant's birth weight 1800g or more?
form4.q6: Absence of alternate cause for encephalopathy?

form5.title: Blood Gas Questions
form5.q1: Is there an available Cord or Postnatal Blood Gas pH obtained within 1hr of birth?
form5.phLabel: Enter Cord or Postnatal Blood Gas pH obtained within 1hr of age:

form6.title: History Questions
form6.q4: Assisted ventilation from birth continued for at least 10 min?

consciousness.2: Hyper-alert, has a stare, jitteriness, high pitched cry, exaggerated response to minimal stimuli, inconsolable

activity.2: Decreased, with or without periods of excessive activity

posture.2: Mild flexion of distal joints (fingers, wrist)

tone.1: Strong flexor tone in all extremities

resp.4: Apnea or on ventilator with or without spontaneous respirations

result.title: Result
result.messageTemplate: Based on the current literature, this patient {{recommendation}} meet criteria for therapeutic hypothermia treatment{{period}} Please use your clinical judgement to decide the best course of treatment for your patient.

validation.notSuggestive: Neonate's condition is not suggestive of encephalopathy.
validation.noModerateSevere: The neonate does not meet criteria for moderate/severe encephalopathy
validation.gestationalAge: The infant's gestational age is less than 36 weeks.
validation.age: The infant is greater than 6 hours old.
validation.birthWeight: The infants birth weight is less than 1800g.
validation.congenital: The infant suffers from congenital abnormalities.
validation.chromosomal: The infant suffers from chromosomal abnormalities.
validation.alternateCause: There is an alternate cause for encephalopathy.
validation.bloodGas: The cord or postnatal blood gas pH is greater than 7.15 and the base deficit is less than -10 mEq/L.
validation.apgarVentilation: The 10 minute Apgar score is greater than 5 and the infant was not mechanically ventilated from birth for at least 10 minutes.
validation.noAcuteEvent: There is no history of an acute event.

summary.sarnatNormal: Patient's neurological exam is normal according to Sarnat staging.
summary.sarnatMild: Patient meets criteria for mild encephalopathy according to Sarnat staging.
summary.sarnatModerateSevere: Patient meets criteria for moderate/severe encephalopathy according to Sarnat staging.
